speaker: IAGO
text:
How
               
              now
              ,

              ?

speaker: RODERIGO
text:
I
               
              do
               
              not
               
              find

speaker: RODERIGO
text:
That
               
              thou
               
              deal’st
               
              justly
               
              with
               
              me
              .

speaker: IAGO
text: What in the contrary?

speaker: RODERIGO
text: Every day thou daff’st me with some device,

speaker: RODERIGO
text: Iago, and rather, as it seems to me now,

speaker: RODERIGO
text: keep’st from me all conveniency than suppliest me

speaker: RODERIGO
text: with the least advantage of hope. I will indeed no

speaker: RODERIGO
text: longer endure it. Nor am I yet persuaded to put up

speaker: RODERIGO
text: in peace what already I have foolishly suffered.

speaker: IAGO
text: Will you hear me, Roderigo?

speaker: RODERIGO
text: Faith, I have heard too much, and your

speaker: RODERIGO
text: words and performances are no kin together.

speaker: IAGO
text: You charge me most unjustly.

speaker: RODERIGO
text: With naught but truth. I have wasted myself

speaker: RODERIGO
text: out of my means. The jewels you have had

speaker: RODERIGO
text: from me to deliver to Desdemona would half have

speaker: RODERIGO
text: corrupted a votaress. You have told me she hath

speaker: RODERIGO
text: received them, and returned me expectations and

speaker: RODERIGO
text: comforts of sudden respect and acquaintance, but I

speaker: RODERIGO
text: find none.

speaker: IAGO
text: Well, go to! Very well.

speaker: RODERIGO
text: “Very well.” “Go to!” I cannot go to, man,

speaker: RODERIGO
text: nor ’tis not very well! By this hand, I say ’tis very

speaker: RODERIGO
text: scurvy, and begin to find myself fopped in it.

speaker: IAGO
text: Very well.

speaker: RODERIGO
text: I tell you ’tis not very well! I will make

speaker: RODERIGO
text: myself known to Desdemona. If she will return me

speaker: RODERIGO
text: my jewels, I will give over my suit and repent my

speaker: RODERIGO
text: unlawful solicitation. If not, assure yourself I will

speaker: RODERIGO
text: seek satisfaction of you.

speaker: IAGO
text: You have said now.

speaker: RODERIGO
text: Ay, and said nothing but what I protest

speaker: RODERIGO
text: intendment of doing.

speaker: IAGO
text: Why, now I see there’s mettle in thee, and even

speaker: IAGO
text: from this instant do build on thee a better opinion

speaker: IAGO
text: than ever before. Give me thy hand, Roderigo.

speaker: IAGO
text: Thou hast taken against me a most just exception,

speaker: IAGO
text: but yet I protest I have dealt most directly in thy

speaker: IAGO
text: affair.

speaker: RODERIGO
text: It hath not appeared.

speaker: IAGO
text: I grant indeed it hath not appeared, and your

speaker: IAGO
text: suspicion is not without wit and judgment. But,

speaker: IAGO
text: Roderigo, if thou hast that in thee indeed which I

speaker: IAGO
text: have greater reason to believe now than ever—I

speaker: IAGO
text: mean purpose, courage, and valor—this night show

speaker: IAGO
text: it. If thou the next night following enjoy not Desdemona,

speaker: IAGO
text: take me from this world with treachery and

speaker: IAGO
text: devise engines for my life.

speaker: RODERIGO
text: Well, what is it? Is it within reason and

speaker: RODERIGO
text: compass?

speaker: IAGO
text: Sir, there is especial commission come from

speaker: IAGO
text: Venice to depute Cassio in Othello’s place.

speaker: RODERIGO
text: Is that true? Why, then, Othello and Desdemona

speaker: RODERIGO
text: return again to Venice.

speaker: IAGO
text: O, no. He goes into Mauritania and takes away

speaker: IAGO
text: with him the fair Desdemona, unless his abode be

speaker: IAGO
text: lingered here by some accident—wherein none

speaker: IAGO
text: can be so determinate as the removing of Cassio.

speaker: RODERIGO
text: How do you mean, removing him?

speaker: IAGO
text: Why, by making him uncapable of Othello’s

speaker: IAGO
text: place: knocking out his brains.

speaker: RODERIGO
text: And that you would have me to do?

speaker: IAGO
text: Ay, if you dare do yourself a profit and a right. He

speaker: IAGO
text: sups tonight with a harlotry, and thither will I go to

speaker: IAGO
text: him. He knows not yet of his honorable fortune. If

speaker: IAGO
text: you will watch his going thence (which I will

speaker: IAGO
text: fashion to fall out between twelve and one), you may

speaker: IAGO
text: take him at your pleasure. I will be near to second

speaker: IAGO
text: your attempt, and he shall fall between us. Come,

speaker: IAGO
text: stand not amazed at it, but go along with me. I will

speaker: IAGO
text: show you such a necessity in his death that you shall

speaker: IAGO
text: think yourself bound to put it on him. It is now high

speaker: IAGO
text: supper time, and the night grows to waste. About it!

speaker: RODERIGO
text: I will hear further reason for this.

speaker: IAGO
text: And you shall be satisfied.
